<!-- üå≥ Earthy Background Style -->
<style>


/* Change background and text color of top navbar */
.navbar {
  background-color: #2c5773 !important;  /* Replace with your preferred color */
  border: none;
}


  html, body {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    font-family: 'Segoe UI', sans-serif;
    overflow-x: hidden;
    background: #d1d7c5;
    color: #1f261f;
    position: relative;
  }

  .background-scene {
    position: fixed;
    z-index: -10;
    top: 0;
    left: 0;
    width: 100%;
    height: 100%;
    overflow: hidden;
  }

  .sun {
    position: absolute;
    top: 40px;
    right: 60px;
    width: 100px;
    height: 100px;
    background: radial-gradient(circle, #ffdf6c, #ffb300);
    border-radius: 50%;
    box-shadow: 0 0 40px rgba(255, 200, 0, 0.4);
    animation: pulseSun 6s ease-in-out infinite;
  }

  @keyframes pulseSun {
    0%, 100% { transform: scale(1); opacity: 1; }
    50% { transform: scale(1.05); opacity: 0.9; }
  }

  .cloud {
    position: absolute;
    top: 80px;
    background: #ffffffcc;
    border-radius: 50px;
    width: 180px;
    height: 60px;
    box-shadow: 60px 0 #ffffffcc, 120px 10px #ffffffcc;
    animation: floatCloud 80s linear infinite;
  }

  .cloud:nth-child(2) {
    top: 140px;
    left: 40%;
    animation-delay: -30s;
    transform: scale(0.8);
  }

  @keyframes floatCloud {
    0% { left: -300px; }
    100% { left: 120%; }
  }

  .mountains {
    position: absolute;
    bottom: 0;
    left: 0;
    width: 100%;
    height: 350px;
    background: linear-gradient(to top, #4a5e44, transparent 60%);
    clip-path: polygon(0% 100%, 10% 60%, 25% 80%, 40% 50%, 60% 80%, 75% 55%, 90% 75%, 100% 40%, 100% 100%);
    transform: translateY(10px);
    z-index: -9;
  }

  .waves {
    position: absolute;
    bottom: 0;
    width: 100%;
    height: 80px;
    background: #2f4f4f;
    clip-path: ellipse(80% 100% at 50% 100%);
    z-index: -8;
  }

  .main-container {
    padding: 50px 30px;
    max-width: 960px;
    margin: 0 auto;
    z-index: 10;
    position: relative;
  }

  .palclim-logo {
    font-size: 84px;
    display: inline-block;
    margin-right: 26px;
    vertical-align: middle;
  }

  .palclim-title {
    display: inline-block;
    vertical-align: middle;
    max-width: 80%;
  }

  .palclim-title h1 {
    font-size: 36px;
    margin-bottom: 6px;
    background: linear-gradient(to right, #2e4728, #132c10);
    -webkit-background-clip: text;
    -webkit-text-fill-color: transparent;
    font-weight: bold;
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);
  }

  .palclim-title .subtitle {
    font-size: 18px;
    color: #2f372e;
    font-weight: 600;
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);
  }

 .palclim-description {
  margin-top: 30px;
  font-size: 18px;
  line-height: 1.85;
  text-align: justify;
  color: #007acc;
}


  .support-note {
    font-style: italic;
    color: #007acc;
    margin-top: 16px;
  }
</style>

</div>

  </div>

  <div class="palclim-description">
   <p>
      <b>PalClim</b> is a community-driven digital initiative focused on developing accessible, browser-based tools for climate and paleoclimate researchers. These tools simplify complex geochemical calculations, facilitate Œ¥<sup>18</sup>O corrections, visualize proxy datasets, and much more ‚Äî all without the need for installation or programming expertise.
    </p>
   <p>
      Designed for early-career scientists, educators, and field researchers, PalClim combines robust science with user-friendly interfaces. Whether you're analyzing marine sediment records, interpreting temperature proxies, or teaching isotope geochemistry, PalClim aims to support your work.
    </p>
   <p>
      The entire platform ‚Äî including hosting and tool development ‚Äî is built and maintained by <b>Dr. Partha Sarathi Jena</b>, a postdoctoral researcher at the University of S√£o Paulo, Brazil.
    </p>
   <p class="support-note">
      This website and its services are personally funded by Dr. Jena without any sponsorship. If you find PalClim useful in your research or teaching, you're warmly welcome to support its development and future tools.
    </p>
  </div>
</div>
